DataWhale Easy-Vibe: Zero to Hero Vibe Coding with Project-Based Learning

Jan 6, 2026
Vibe Sparking

DataWhale Easy-Vibe: Zero to Hero Vibe Coding with Project-Based Learning

Section titled “DataWhale Easy-Vibe: Zero to Hero Vibe Coding with Project-Based Learning”

In 2025, AI programming has entered a new era. While more developers are using AI to write code, many struggle to move beyond toy projects. The DataWhale Easy-Vibe project addresses this gap with a comprehensive, project-based curriculum for mastering vibe coding - the art of collaborating with AI to build production-ready applications.

Overview

Section titled “Overview”

Repository: datawhalechina/easy-vibe

Stats:

Easy-Vibe is a Chinese-language open-source curriculum that teaches you to become a one-person team - handling frontend, backend, AI algorithm development, and product management simultaneously through AI-powered development.

What is Vibe Coding?

Section titled “What is Vibe Coding?”

Vibe coding represents a paradigm shift in software development:

  • Traditional coding: You write every line manually
  • Vibe coding: You orchestrate AI tools to generate, review, and refine code while focusing on product vision and architecture

The key insight: You become the conductor, not the musician.

Why Easy-Vibe Stands Out

Section titled “Why Easy-Vibe Stands Out”

1. Project-Based Learning Structure

Section titled “1. Project-Based Learning Structure”

Unlike tutorials that focus on isolated concepts, Easy-Vibe uses 9 progressive projects across 3 stages:

Stage 1: Local Foundation (Beginner)

Section titled “Stage 1: Local Foundation (Beginner)”
  • Project 1: Build a Snake Game - Web AI programming basics, API integration
  • Project 2: Explore AI Tool Boundaries - Prompt engineering, image/video generation APIs
  • Project 3: Dify & Knowledge Base Integration - RAG, workflow orchestration

Stage 2: Database & Full-Stack Deployment (Intermediate)

Section titled “Stage 2: Database & Full-Stack Deployment (Intermediate)”
  • Project 4: Hogwarts Portrait Generator - Frontend prototyping to code, AI IDE basics
  • Project 5: Database to Supabase - JSON, backend services, authentication, edge functions
  • Project 6: Product Thinking First - Product思维, abstraction, user needs

Stage 3: Modern Full-Stack Applications (Advanced)

Section titled “Stage 3: Modern Full-Stack Applications (Advanced)”
  • Project 7: Modern Application - UI Design
  • Project 8: Modern Application - Feature Design
  • Project 9: Modern Application - Full-Stack Implementation

2. Comprehensive Extension Knowledge

Section titled “2. Comprehensive Extension Knowledge”

11 supplementary modules covering essential development foundations:

ModuleTopicsDifficulty
Git & GitHubVersion control, collaboration, SSHBeginner
API BasicsHTTP, requests/responses, third-party integrationBeginner
AI DictionaryLLM/image/audio/video models, AI engineering landscapeBeginner
AI IDE & TraeIDE concepts, Trae tool practical guideBeginner
RAG PrinciplesDocument chunking, indexing, enterprise solutionsIntermediate
Zeabur DeploymentWeb app deployment, Zeabur platformIntermediate
CLI AI ToolsTerminal, Claude Code/CodexIntermediate

Librarian: Local CLI Tool for Coding Agents to Search Developer Documentation

Jan 6, 2026
Vibe Sparking

Introduction

Section titled “Introduction”

AI coding assistants are powerful, but they often work with outdated or incomplete documentation. Librarian solves this problem by fetching and searching up-to-date developer documentation locally on your machine, giving AI agents real context so they stop guessing and write better code.

GitHub: https://github.com/iannuttall/librarian

Librarian supports both GitHub repositories and public websites, making it a versatile tool for keeping your AI assistant’s knowledge fresh and accurate.

Key Features

Section titled “Key Features”

Local Documentation Management

Section titled “Local Documentation Management”
  • Fetch docs from GitHub repos - Clone and index documentation from any public repository
  • Crawl public websites - Automatically discover and index docs from llms.txt, sitemap.xml, or robots.txt
  • Hybrid search - Combine word search with semantic vector search for best results
  • Version-aware - Track documentation versions to avoid mixed results

AI Agent Integration

Section titled “AI Agent Integration”
  • MCP Server - Built-in Model Context Protocol server for seamless integration
  • Agent skills - Pre-built skills for Codex, Claude Code, and Factory
  • JSON output - Machine-readable results for automated workflows

Flexible Search Modes

Section titled “Flexible Search Modes”
  • Hybrid search - Word + meaning (default, most accurate)
  • Word search - Traditional keyword matching
  • Vector search - Pure semantic similarity

Quick Start

Section titled “Quick Start”

Installation

Section titled “Installation”

During setup, you can choose to install globally. If global install is selected, use librarian directly. Otherwise, use ./librarian.

Section titled “Adding Documentation Sources”

Section titled “From GitHub Repositories”

Section titled “MCP Server Integration”

Librarian includes a built-in MCP server for integration with AI coding assistants:

Available MCP Tools:

  • search - Search documentation with mode options (word/vector/hybrid)
  • library - Find and list libraries/versions
  • get - Retrieve specific documentation

Section titled “Agent Skills”

Librarian provides pre-built skills using progressive disclosure (only name/description load at startup).

  • Note: Codex web and iOS don’t support direct invocation yet

Section titled “For Factory”

Configuration

Section titled “Configuration”

Configuration file: ~/.config/librarian/config.yml

Important Notes

Section titled “Important Notes”
  • Setup downloads a local embedding model for vector search
  • Public GitHub repos don’t require a token
  • Website crawling auto-detects CSR/SPA sites and uses headless Chrome
  • Chrome is auto-detected but can be manually configured
  • Run librarian setup to verify Chrome availability
  • If librarian command doesn’t work, use ./librarian

  • Framework-specific patterns - Search framework docs for best practices
  • Troubleshooting - Find relevant error messages and solutions from official docs

  • Language: TypeScript (99.9%)
  • Package Manager: Bun
  • Embedding Model: Local (downloaded during setup)
  • Crawler: Headless Chrome for SPA/CSR sites

Conclusion

Section titled “Conclusion”

Librarian addresses a critical gap in AI-assisted development: keeping documentation context current and accurate. By running locally and supporting both GitHub repos and public websites, it gives AI coding agents the real-time context they need to write better code instead of guessing based on outdated training data.

Whether you’re using Claude Code, Codex, or building custom AI agents, Librarian provides the infrastructure for accurate, up-to-date documentation search.

TEN Framework: Open-Source Framework for Conversational Voice AI Agents

Jan 6, 2026
Vibe Sparking

Introduction

Section titled “Introduction”

TEN Framework is an open-source framework for real-time multimodal conversational AI agents. It enables developers to easily build intelligent applications with voice, vision, and avatar capabilities.

Official Website: https://theten.ai/ GitHub: https://github.com/TEN-framework/ten-framework

The TEN ecosystem includes several core components:

  • TEN Framework: Core conversational AI agent framework
  • TEN VAD: Low-latency, lightweight streaming voice activity detector
  • TEN Turn Detection: Enables full-duplex dialogue communication
  • TEN Portal: Official documentation and blog site
  • Agent Examples: Rich collection of use case examples

Key Features

Section titled “Key Features”

Multi-Purpose Voice Assistant

Section titled “Multi-Purpose Voice Assistant”

TEN Framework provides low-latency, high-quality real-time voice assistants supporting both RTC and WebSocket connections. Easily extend with:

  • Memory: Remember conversation history
  • VAD: Voice Activity Detection for intelligent speech recognition
  • Turn Detection: Natural dialogue flow management

Avatar Integration

Section titled “Avatar Integration”

Support for multiple avatar providers:

  • Live2D: Anime-style virtual characters (e.g., Kei with MotionSync lip-sync)
  • Trulience: Realistic 3D avatars
  • HeyGen: High-quality AI virtual humans
  • Tavus: Personalized avatars

Speech Diarization & Transcription

Section titled “Speech Diarization & Transcription”
  • Real-time diarization: Detect and label different speakers
  • Transcription tools: Convert audio to text in real-time

SIP Phone Integration

Section titled “SIP Phone Integration”

Connect AI agents with traditional telephone networks through SIP extension, supporting services like Twilio.

Hardware Integration

Section titled “Hardware Integration”

Support for ESP32-S3 Korvo V3 development board, enabling LLM-powered communication on hardware devices.

Section titled “Considerations”

API Costs

Section titled “API Costs”

TEN Framework itself is free and open-source, but depends on third-party services:

  • OpenAI: Billed per token

  • ElevenLabs: Billed per character
  • Agora: Free tier available, then billed per minute

Agent Zero: The Dynamic, Self-Learning AI Framework That Writes Its Own Tools

Jan 6, 2026
Vibe Sparking

Agent Zero: The Dynamic, Self-Learning AI Framework That Writes Its Own Tools

Section titled “Agent Zero: The Dynamic, Self-Learning AI Framework That Writes Its Own Tools”

In the rapidly evolving landscape of AI agent frameworks, one project stands apart by rejecting the very concept of predefined behaviors. Agent Zero isn’t just another tool—it’s a dynamic, organically growing system that learns as you use it.

What Makes Agent Zero Different?

Section titled “What Makes Agent Zero Different?”

Most AI frameworks come with pre-programmed behaviors and hard-coded rails. Agent Zero takes a radically different approach:

  • Not a predefined framework - It’s designed to grow and learn dynamically
  • Fully transparent - Every prompt, tool, and behavior is readable and customizable
  • Computer as a tool - It writes its own code and creates tools as needed
  • Multi-agent hierarchy - Agents create subordinates to solve complex tasks
  • Persistent memory - Solutions and facts are remembered for future efficiency

Core Architecture: How Agent Zero Works

Section titled “Core Architecture: How Agent Zero Works”

1. General-Purpose Assistant Philosophy

Section titled “1. General-Purpose Assistant Philosophy”

Agent Zero doesn’t specialize in one task—it’s designed to be your universal personal assistant. Give it any task:

  • Development Projects - “Create a React dashboard with real-time data visualization”
  • Data Analysis - “Analyze last quarter’s NVIDIA sales data and create trend reports”
  • Content Creation - “Write a technical blog post about microservices”
  • System Administration - “Set up monitoring for our web servers”
  • Research - “Summarize five recent AI papers about Chain-of-Thought prompting”

2. Tool Creation Philosophy

Section titled “2. Tool Creation Philosophy”

Unlike frameworks with predefined tools, Agent Zero comes with minimal defaults:

Default Tools:

  • Online search
  • Memory features
  • Communication (user and inter-agent)
  • Code/terminal execution

Everything else is created by the agent itself. Need a specific API integration? Agent Zero writes the code. Need a data processing pipeline? It builds it using the terminal.

3. Multi-Agent Cooperation

Section titled “3. Multi-Agent Cooperation”

Every agent has a superior agent providing tasks and instructions. This creates a natural hierarchy:

  • Agent 0’s superior = The human user
  • Subordinate agents = Created automatically when tasks need breaking down
  • Clean context = Each agent focuses on its specific subtask
  • Results flow up = Each agent reports back to its superior

This approach keeps contexts focused and enables parallel problem-solving.

4. Complete Customizability

Section titled “4. Complete Customizability”

Nothing is hidden. Everything can be changed:

  • System prompts - prompts/default/agent.system.md defines core behavior
  • Message templates - Every communication template lives in prompts/
  • Tools - Default tools in python/tools/ can be modified or copied
  • Extensions - Add new capabilities through the extensions framework

Projects: Isolated Workspaces

Section titled “Projects: Isolated Workspaces”

A major recent addition is Projects - dedicated workspaces that keep contexts separate:

  • Custom instructions per project
  • Isolated memory and knowledge bases
  • Project-specific secrets
  • Dedicated file storage

This means you can have one project for web development, another for data analysis, and never mix contexts.

Installation & Setup

Section titled “Installation & Setup”

Quick Start with Docker

Section titled “Quick Start with Docker”

Platform-Specific Setup

Section titled “Platform-Specific Setup”

Detailed installation guides for Windows, macOS, and Linux are available in the official documentation, complete with video tutorials.

The Web UI Experience

Section titled “The Web UI Experience”

The web interface provides:

  • Real-time streaming - Watch the agent think and act
  • Intervention - Stop and redirect at any point
  • Chat persistence - Save and load conversations
  • HTML logs - Every session automatically saved
  • Settings dashboard - Customize agent behavior

Communication: The Key to Success

Section titled “Communication: The Key to Success”

The effectiveness of Agent Zero depends heavily on how you communicate with it:

  • System prompts matter - Good instructions enable miracles
  • Regular check-ins - Configure agents to report back for permission
  • Point-scoring systems - Help agents decide when to delegate
  • Verification - Superiors can double-check subordinates’ work

Warning: With Great Power Comes Great Responsibility

Section titled “Warning: With Great Power Comes Great Responsibility”

“Agent Zero can be dangerous! Always run in an isolated environment (like Docker) and be careful what you wish for.”

With proper instruction, Agent Zero is capable of actions affecting your computer, data, and accounts. The framework provides power—use it wisely.

Recent Developments

Section titled “Recent Developments”

The project is actively developed with frequent releases adding:

  • Projects management - Isolated workspaces with dedicated resources
  • Memory Management Dashboard - Visualize and organize learned information
  • Secrets management - Use credentials without exposing them to the agent
  • MCP Server support - Both as server and client
  • Browser agent integration - Web automation capabilities
  • TTS/STT - Speech interaction
  • Multi-model support - OpenAI, OpenRouter, Venice.ai, and more

Documentation Structure

Section titled “Documentation Structure”
PageDescription
InstallationSetup and configuration
UsageBasic and advanced usage
DevelopmentCustomization guide
ExtensibilityExtending Agent Zero
ConnectivityAPIs, MCP, A2A protocol
ArchitectureSystem design

Comparison: Agent Zero vs. Traditional Frameworks

Section titled “Comparison: Agent Zero vs. Traditional Frameworks”
FeatureAgent ZeroTraditional Frameworks
BehaviorDynamic, learnedPredefined
TransparencyFully visibleOften black-box
CustomizationEverything editableLimited hooks
Tool CreationSelf-writtenPre-built only
Multi-AgentHierarchical delegationFlat coordination
MemoryPersistent, automaticSession-based
ExtensibilityModify core behaviorPlugin-based

Best Practices for Using Agent Zero

Section titled “Best Practices for Using Agent Zero”

1. Start with Clear System Prompts

Section titled “1. Start with Clear System Prompts”

The quality of your results depends heavily on the system prompt. Be explicit about:

  • Communication style
  • Decision-making criteria
  • When to ask for permission
  • How to report progress

2. Use Projects for Different Contexts

Section titled “2. Use Projects for Different Contexts”

Keep your development work separate from research, and both separate from personal tasks.

3. Leverage the Memory System

Section titled “3. Leverage the Memory System”

When Agent Zero solves a problem well, it remembers. Feed it quality examples and solutions.

4. Intervene When Needed

Section titled “4. Intervene When Needed”

Don’t let a confused agent spiral. The real-time streaming lets you catch issues early.

5. Always Use Docker for Production

Section titled “5. Always Use Docker for Production”

The framework can execute arbitrary code. Isolation is mandatory for safety.

Community & Resources

Section titled “Community & Resources”
  • GitHub: agent0ai/agent-zero
  • Website: agent-zero.ai
  • YouTube: @AgentZeroFW
  • Discord: Join the community
  • Documentation: Full docs

Conclusion

Section titled “Conclusion”

Agent Zero represents a philosophy shift in AI agents: rather than pre-programming behaviors, give agents the ability to learn, create tools, and organize themselves. It’s not for everyone—it requires more communication and supervision—but for those who want transparency and extensibility, it offers unparalleled control.

Whether you’re building automation workflows, analyzing data, or exploring AI capabilities, Agent Zero provides a framework that grows with you rather than constraining you.

Want to explore more? Check out the GitHub repository and join the community shaping the future of dynamic AI agents.

CLIProxyAPI Transform Your AI Subscriptions into Universal API Endpoints

Jan 4, 2026
Vibe Sparking

CLIProxyAPI: Transform Your AI Subscriptions into Universal API Endpoints

Section titled “CLIProxyAPI: Transform Your AI Subscriptions into Universal API Endpoints”

Introduction

Section titled “Introduction”

In the rapidly evolving landscape of AI coding tools, developers often face a fragmentation problem: premium subscriptions are locked behind OAuth authentication, while many tools and SDKs expect standard API keys. CLIProxyAPI elegantly solves this bridge by converting OAuth-based AI services into universal API endpoints.

What is CLIProxyAPI?

Section titled “What is CLIProxyAPI?”

CLIProxyAPI is an open-source proxy server written in Go that wraps multiple AI CLI tools and exposes them through standardized API interfaces. It transforms your existing AI subscriptions into OpenAI/Gemini/Claude-compatible APIs, eliminating the need for separate API keys.

Project: router-for-me/CLIProxyAPI License: MIT Language: Go (99.7%)

Key Features and Highlights

Section titled “Key Features and Highlights”

1. Multi-Provider OAuth Integration

Section titled “1. Multi-Provider OAuth Integration”

CLIProxyAPI supports OAuth authentication for leading AI services:

  • Claude Code - Anthropic’s Claude models via OAuth
  • ChatGPT / OpenAI Codex - GPT series models
  • Gemini CLI - Google’s Gemini models
  • Qwen Code - Alibaba’s Qwen models
  • iFlow - Additional AI service support
  • Antigravity - Alternative AI provider

2. Universal API Compatibility

Section titled “2. Universal API Compatibility”

The proxy provides standardized endpoints compatible with:

  • OpenAI API format
  • Gemini API format
  • Claude API format
  • Codex API format

This means your existing OpenAI SDK code works without modification—just change the base URL.

3. Advanced Account Management

Section titled “3. Advanced Account Management”
  • Multi-account support with round-robin load balancing
  • Hot reload configuration changes take effect without restart
  • OAuth session management with automatic token refresh
  • Model mapping for intelligent fallback (e.g., claude-opus-4.5 → claude-sonnet-4)

4. Comprehensive Feature Set

Section titled “4. Comprehensive Feature Set”
  • Streaming and non-streaming responses
  • Function calling / tools support
  • Multimodal input (text and images)
  • Management API for runtime configuration
  • Reusable Go SDK for embedding
  • Docker containerization support

Prerequisites, Installation and Configuration

Section titled “Prerequisites, Installation and Configuration”

System Requirements

Section titled “System Requirements”
  • Go 1.21+ (for building from source)
  • Docker (optional, for containerized deployment)
  • Valid subscriptions for supported AI services

Section titled “Installation Methods”

Method 1: Build from Source

Section titled “Method 1: Build from Source”

Section titled “Use Case 1: AI Coding Tool Integration”

  • Claude Code desktop app
  • Cline VS Code extension
  • Roo Code assistant
  • Continue.dev autopilot

Precautions, FAQ and Troubleshooting

Section titled “Precautions, FAQ and Troubleshooting”

Common Issues

Section titled “Common Issues”

Q: OAuth token expires frequently

A: CLIProxyAPI handles automatic token refresh. Ensure your OAuth credentials are valid and check system time synchronization.

Q: Model not available

A: Use model mapping to route unavailable models to alternatives:

Q: Rate limiting errors

A: Enable multi-account load balancing to distribute requests across accounts.

Security Considerations

Section titled “Security Considerations”
  • Management API endpoints bind to localhost only
  • OAuth tokens are stored securely
  • Never expose your proxy to public internet without authentication
  • Regular audit logs track all API requests

Troubleshooting Tips

Section titled “Troubleshooting Tips”
  1. Check logs: tail -f cliproxyapi.log
  2. Verify OAuth sessions via Management API
  3. Test with simple curl command first
  4. Ensure firewall allows localhost communication

Reference Links

Section titled “Reference Links”
  • GitHub Repository: https://github.com/router-for-me/CLIProxyAPI
  • Documentation: https://help.router-for.me/
  • Management API: https://help.router-for.me/management/api
  • Chinese README: README_CN.md
  • Community Guides: linux.do tutorials

Conclusion

Section titled “Conclusion”

CLIProxyAPI represents a pragmatic solution to AI service fragmentation, transforming OAuth-based subscriptions into universal API endpoints. Whether you’re integrating with coding tools, balancing load across accounts, or simply avoiding API key management, CLIProxyAPI provides a robust, open-source foundation.

With active development (1,239+ commits), comprehensive documentation in both English and Chinese, and a growing ecosystem of companion tools, CLIProxyAPI is poised to become an essential utility in the AI developer’s toolkit.

  • Universal API compatibility with OpenAI/Gemini/Claude formats
  • Multi-account load balancing and management features
  • Installation via source, Docker, or pre-built binaries
  • Ecosystem of related projects (vibeproxy, ProxyPal, Quotio, CodMate)
  • Security considerations and troubleshooting guide

CodMate: The Ultimate macOS Session Manager for CLI AI Tools

Jan 4, 2026
Vibe Sparking

Introduction

Section titled “Introduction”

If you’re a developer who uses CLI-based AI tools like Claude Code, Codex, or Gemini CLI, you know the pain of managing hundreds of scattered session files. Finding that brilliant solution from last Tuesday, resuming a suspended project context, or even just reviewing what you accomplished can be frustrating.

Enter CodMate—a native macOS SwiftUI application that brings order to your AI coding chaos. Built with performance in mind and designed for developers who value their time, CodMate transforms how you interact with your AI programming assistants.

What is CodMate?

Section titled “What is CodMate?”

CodMate is a session manager for CLI AI tools that provides:

  • Multi-source session browsing supporting Codex, Claude Code, and Gemini CLI
  • Blazing-fast search with incremental indexing and caching
  • Compact three-column UI designed for efficient workflow
  • “Ship it” workflows like Project Review with Git Changes
  • One-click Resume/New functionality

Built with Swift 6 and SwiftUI, CodMate leverages macOS 13.5+ APIs to deliver a truly native experience with universal binary support (Apple Silicon + Intel).

Key Features

Section titled “Key Features”

Lightning-Fast Search & Navigation

Section titled “Lightning-Fast Search & Navigation”

CodMate’s global search panel (⌘F) offers scoped search with progress/cancel capabilities, plus quick list filtering. The app uses:

  • Memory-mapped reads for fast path indexing
  • Incremental parsing (first ~64 lines + tail sampling)
  • Background enrichment with constrained task groups
  • Chunked full-text search (128 KB) that avoids loading entire files

Project & Task Organization

Section titled “Project & Task Organization”

Keep your work organized with:

  • Projects that group sessions by repository
  • Tasks that group sessions by goal
  • Shareable task context files for team collaboration
  • Auto-assignment for new sessions in active projects

Terminal Integration

Section titled “Terminal Integration”

Resume sessions directly into your preferred terminal:

  • Terminal.app
  • iTerm2
  • Warp
  • Embedded terminal (non-sandbox builds)

Project Review (Git Changes)

Section titled “Project Review (Git Changes)”

One of CodMate’s most powerful features is the Project Review mode, which shows:

  • Changed files with stage/unstage support
  • Unified diff or raw preview
  • Commit UI with AI-powered commit message generation
  • On-demand repo authorization

MCP Server Management

Section titled “MCP Server Management”

CodMate includes comprehensive MCP server support:

  • Uni-Import (paste/drag JSON configuration)
  • Per-server enable toggles
  • Per-target toggles (Codex/Claude/Gemini)
  • Connectivity testing
  • Automatic export to ~/.claude/settings.json

Installation

Section titled “Installation”

Download

Section titled “Download”

Latest version: 0.4.2

Download for Apple Silicon | Download for Intel Mac

Prerequisites

Section titled “Prerequisites”
  • macOS 13.5 or later
  • Swift 6 toolchain
  • Xcode Command Line Tools
  • Your preferred AI CLI (Codex / Claude / Gemini) installed

Architecture & Performance

Section titled “Architecture & Performance”

CodMate is built with clean architecture principles:

Performance highlights:

  • Persistent SQLite index for fast launches
  • Actor-based services for safe concurrency
  • Cancel-able tasks with proper cancellation guards
  • File IO prefers memory-mapped data and chunked reads

FAQ

Section titled “FAQ”

Q: Does CodMate modify my session files?

A: No, CodMate only reads session files. Notes, project assignments, and other metadata are stored separately.

Q: Can I use CodMate with multiple CLI tools simultaneously?

A: Yes! CodMate supports Codex, Claude Code, and Gemini CLI concurrently.

Q: Is my session data sent anywhere?

A: CodMate is local-first. Your session data never leaves your Mac unless you explicitly use features that call external APIs (like AI commit message generation).

Q: How does CodMate handle large session files?

A: CodMate uses intelligent parsing—reading only what’s needed for display, with background enrichment for full content. This keeps the UI fast even with thousands of sessions.

doocs/cose: One-Click Markdown Publishing to 13+ Content Platforms

Jan 4, 2026
Vibe Sparking

doocs/cose: One-Click Markdown Publishing to 13+ Content Platforms

Section titled “doocs/cose: One-Click Markdown Publishing to 13+ Content Platforms”

“Write once, publish everywhere” - the dream of every content creator.

If you’re a technical writer, developer, or content creator who publishes across multiple platforms, you know the pain of copying and pasting your content to each platform individually. Each platform has its own editor, formatting quirks, and login flow. It’s tedious, error-prone, and wastes valuable time.

doocs/cose solves this problem elegantly. As a browser extension designed for the popular doocs/md Markdown editor, cose enables one-click synchronization of your articles to 13+ content platforms simultaneously.

Introduction and Key Features

Section titled “Introduction and Key Features”

doocs/cose (short for “Content One-click SynchronizE”) is a browser extension developed by Yang Shuang (lead1314) that integrates seamlessly with the doocs/md Markdown editor. Its mission is simple: eliminate the friction of multi-platform content publishing.

Core Philosophy

Section titled “Core Philosophy”
  • 100% Local Operation - No data collection, no cloud storage, complete privacy
  • Write Once, Publish Everywhere - Edit in Markdown, sync to all platforms
  • Automatic Tab Management - Synced tabs are grouped for easy organization
  • Style Preservation - Especially for WeChat Official Account with full rendering

Section titled “Supported Platforms (13+)”
CategoryPlatforms

Section titled “Prerequisites”

  3. doocs/md Markdown Editor - either the web version at md.doocs.org or a local development environment

  1. Install the Extension following one of the methods above
  2. Open doocs/md at md.doocs.org or your local instance
  3. Login to Platforms - Open each platform you want to publish to and login
  4. Grant Permissions - The extension will request necessary permissions on first use

Recommended Scenarios and Best Practices

Section titled “Recommended Scenarios and Best Practices”

Daily Workflow for Content Creators

Section titled “Daily Workflow for Content Creators”

Use doocs/md editor to craft your content:

Step 2: Preview and Refine

Section titled “Step 2: Preview and Refine”

The doocs/md editor provides real-time preview with:

  • Live rendering as you type
  • WeChat style preview for accurate formatting
  • Syntax highlighting for code blocks
  • Table editor for easy table creation

Step 3: One-Click Publish

Section titled “Step 3: One-Click Publish”
  1. Click the “Publish” (发布) button at the top of the editor
  2. A dialog appears showing all supported platforms
  3. Select the platforms you want to publish to
  4. Click “Confirm” (确定) to start synchronization

Step 4: Review and Manage

Section titled “Step 4: Review and Manage”
  • Tab Grouping: Synced tabs are automatically grouped
  • Login Detection: Extension shows which platforms you’re logged into
  • Draft Saving: WeChat articles are saved as drafts with full styling

Best Practices

Section titled “Best Practices”

  1. Platform-Specific Adjustments

    • Some platforms have title length limits
    • Image hosting varies (use external hosting for better compatibility)
    • Tags/keywords work differently per platform

  2. Content Organization

    • Use clear heading structures (H1, H2, H3)
    • Keep paragraphs concise for mobile readers
    • Test code blocks on platforms that support syntax highlighting

  3. WeChat Special Handling

    • cose preserves full rendering styles for WeChat
    • Articles are saved as drafts (not auto-published)
    • Review in WeChat editor before final publication

  4. Batch Publishing

    • Select multiple platforms at once
    • The extension handles each platform’s API differently
    • Monitor each tab for completion status

Precautions

Section titled “Precautions”
  1. Login Status: Ensure you’re logged into each platform before syncing
  2. Content Format: Some platforms may strip certain Markdown features
  3. Image Hosting: Use external image hosting (not local file references)
  4. Rate Limits: Some platforms may have anti-spam mechanisms
  5. Draft Review: Always review synced content, especially for WeChat

FAQ

Section titled “FAQ”

Q: Is my content secure? A: Yes. The extension operates 100% locally. No data is collected or stored on external servers.

Q: Why did my sync fail on Platform X? A: Common reasons include: not logged in, network issues, platform API changes, or content format restrictions. Check the browser console for error details.

Q: Can I sync to platforms not listed? A: The project welcomes contributions. Submit an Issue or PR for new platform support.

Q: Does it work with local doocs/md? A: Yes, the extension works with both the web version at md.doocs.org and local development environments.

Q: What happens to code blocks? A: cose attempts to preserve code formatting, but syntax highlighting support varies by platform. Test on your target platforms first.

Liquid AI Cookbook: Examples, Tutorials and Apps Built with LFM Models

Jan 4, 2026
Vibe Sparking

Introduction

Section titled “Introduction”

As artificial intelligence continues to evolve, the demand for efficient, deployable models that can run on edge devices has grown significantly. Liquid AI has emerged as a key player in this space with their open-weight LFM (Liquid Foundation Models) and the open-source LEAP SDK.

The Liquid AI Cookbook is a comprehensive repository containing examples, tutorials, and applications built with these technologies. Whether you’re looking to customize models, deploy to laptops and edge devices, or build complete applications, this cookbook provides the resources to get started.

What is Liquid AI?

Section titled “What is Liquid AI?”

Liquid AI is developing a new generation of hybrid models designed specifically for on-device deployment. Their LFM2 models range from 350M to 8B parameters, making them ideal for edge deployment while maintaining strong performance on agentic tasks, data extraction, RAG, creative writing, and multi-turn conversations.

Key Characteristics

Section titled “Key Characteristics”
  • Hybrid Architecture: Combines different modeling techniques for efficiency
  • On-Device First: Designed from the ground up for edge deployment
  • Specialized Models: Task-specific checkpoints for extraction, RAG, tool use, and math
  • Multi-Modal Support: Vision-language models (LFM2-VL) for visual understanding
  • Edge SDK: Native framework for mobile deployment (Android/iOS)

LFM2 Model Family

Section titled “LFM2 Model Family”

Text-to-Text Models

Section titled “Text-to-Text Models”

The LFM2 series is designed for agentic tasks and on-device deployment:

LFM2-8B-A1B8BComplex reasoning, multi-turn conversations
LFM2-2.6B2.6BBalanced performance and efficiency
LFM2-1.2B1.2BMobile deployment, real-time applications

LFM2-350M350MUltra-low latency scenarios

LEAP Edge SDK

Section titled “LEAP Edge SDK”

The LEAP Edge SDK is Liquid AI’s native framework for running LFM2 models on mobile devices. It provides:

  • Native Support: Android (Kotlin) and iOS (Swift)
  • Simple API: As easy as calling cloud LLM endpoints
  • Real-Time Streaming: Token streaming for responsive chat experiences
  • Persistent History: Built-in conversation management

When to Use LFM2 Models

Section titled “When to Use LFM2 Models”

Best for:

  • Agentic tasks and workflows
  • Data extraction and transformation
  • RAG applications

  • Math reasoning (with specialized models)

Not recommended for:

Deployment Considerations

Section titled “Deployment Considerations”

Mobile/Edge:

  • Start with 1.2B or smaller for mobile devices
  • Use specialized models (Extract, RAG, Tool) for specific tasks
  • Consider the trade-off between model size and response quality

Desktop/Laptop:

  • 2.6B to 8B models provide good performance
  • More RAM allows for larger context windows
  • Consider GPU acceleration for better performance

llm-madness: A Lightweight Pipeline for Training Small GPT Models with Web UI

Jan 4, 2026
Vibe Sparking

llm-madness: A Lightweight Pipeline for Training Small GPT Models with Web UI

Section titled “llm-madness: A Lightweight Pipeline for Training Small GPT Models with Web UI”

Training a custom GPT model from scratch typically requires complex infrastructure, expensive cloud resources, and specialized tooling. MaxHastings’ llm-madness inverts this assumption by providing a lightweight, end-to-end pipeline for training small GPT models locally, complete with a web-based UI for experiment management.

Introduction and Key Features

Section titled “Introduction and Key Features”

llm-madness is a Python-based toolkit that brings GPT model training within reach of individual developers and researchers. It provides everything needed to train custom language models: from BPE tokenizer training to model architecture design, from dataset management to run inspection—all through an intuitive web interface.

What Makes llm-madness Different

Section titled “What Makes llm-madness Different”
FeatureDescription
Complete PipelineData → Tokenizer → Tokenization → Training → Inspection
Web-Based UIVisual interface for configs, datasets, and run analysis
GPT ArchitectureClean, readable transformer implementation
Local-FirstNo cloud accounts or external services required
Experiment TrackingBuilt-in manifest system with provenance tracking

Core Capabilities

Section titled “Core Capabilities”
  1. Tokenizer Training - Configure BPE settings and build vocabularies from your own datasets
  2. Model Architecture - Design GPT-style transformers with configurable dimensions
  3. Dataset Management - Combine text files into versioned snapshots with SHA-256 hashing
  4. Training Infrastructure - AdamW optimizer with warmup, cosine decay, and checkpointing
  5. Run Inspection - Visualize loss curves, attention patterns, and token predictions
  6. Pipeline Orchestration - Chain stages together with automatic dependency resolution

Prerequisites, Installation and Configuration

Section titled “Prerequisites, Installation and Configuration”

Prerequisites

Section titled “Prerequisites”
  • Python 3.8+ with pip
  • PyTorch for model training
  • (Optional) CUDA/MPS for GPU acceleration

Installation

Section titled “Installation”

Quick Start

Section titled “Quick Start”

The web UI will automatically load and display your latest training run.

Project Structure

Section titled “Project Structure”

Recommended Scenarios and Best Practices

Best Practices

Section titled “Best Practices”
  1. Start Small - Begin with tiny models (6 layers, 6 heads) to iterate quickly
  2. Version Everything - Use the manifest system to track experiments
  3. Monitor Closely - Check loss curves and samples during training
  4. Compare Runs - Use versioned configs for ablation studies
  5. Cache Tokens - Enable token cache to avoid re-tokenizing large datasets

Precautions, FAQ, and Troubleshooting

Section titled “Precautions, FAQ, and Troubleshooting”

Important Considerations

Section titled “Important Considerations”

⚠️ Not for Large-Scale Training

llm-madness is designed for small, reproducible experiments. It’s not suitable for:

  • Training models with billions of parameters
  • Distributed training across multiple GPUs
  • Production-scale inference

⚠️ GPU Memory Limits

Even “small” models require significant GPU memory:

  • A 6-layer, 6-head model may need 4-8GB VRAM
  • Consider reducing batch size or model dimensions if OOM occurs
  • CPU training is supported but much slower

⚠️ Training Data Quality

The quality of your output depends entirely on your training data:

  • Clean and preprocess text before training
  • Remove duplicates and low-quality content
  • Balance your dataset if training on multiple sources

FAQ

Section titled “FAQ”

Q: What model sizes can I train?

A: llm-madness is optimized for models in the 1M-100M parameter range. Larger models may work but will be slow without significant GPU resources.

Q: Can I use pre-trained tokenizers?

A: The toolkit focuses on training custom BPE tokenizers, but you can modify the code to load pre-trained tokenizers like GPT-2’s.

Q: How do I enable GPU acceleration?

A: Install PyTorch with CUDA support. The toolkit automatically detects and uses CUDA if available, falling back to MPS (Apple Silicon) or CPU.

Q: Can I fine-tune existing models?

A: llm-madness is designed for training from scratch. For fine-tuning, consider tools like Hugging Face Transformers.

Q: What are the modern architecture flags?

A:

  • use_rmsnorm - RMSNorm instead of LayerNorm
  • use_swiglu - Gated FFN (SwiGLU) instead of GELU
  • use_rope - Rotary position embeddings
  • use_sdpa - Scaled dot-product attention (CUDA only)
  • use_kv_cache - Faster autoregressive generation

CUDA out of memoryReduce batch size or model dimensions
Slow trainingEnable GPU acceleration or use smaller models
Poor generation qualityTrain longer, use more data, or adjust temperature
Tokenizer errorsCheck input file encoding and format
Web UI not loadingEnsure all dependencies are installed

Compound Engineering Plugin: Official Claude Code Plugin That Makes Each Unit of Engineering Work Easier

Jan 3, 2026
Vibe Sparking

Compound Engineering Plugin: Official Claude Code Plugin That Makes Each Unit of Engineering Work Easier

Section titled “Compound Engineering Plugin: Official Claude Code Plugin That Makes Each Unit of Engineering Work Easier”

“Each unit of engineering work should make subsequent units easier—not harder.”

In traditional software development, every feature added makes the next feature harder to build. More code means more edge cases, more interdependencies, and more complexity. This accumulation of technical debt is the default trajectory for most codebases.

EveryInc’s compound-engineering-plugin for Claude Code inverts this paradigm. It implements a compound engineering methodology where each unit of work makes future work easier through a systematic learning loop.

Introduction and Key Features

Section titled “Introduction and Key Features”

The compound-engineering-plugin is an official Claude Code plugin developed by EveryInc that orchestrates AI agents to plan, write, review, and compound engineering knowledge. The plugin embodies a revolutionary approach to software development where:

  • 80% of effort goes into planning and review - ensuring thorough understanding before code is written
  • 20% goes into execution - leveraging AI agents for code generation
  • Knowledge compounds over time - each lesson learned feeds back into the system

Key Highlights

Section titled “Key Highlights”
FeatureDescription
Four-Step WorkflowPlan → Work → Review → Compound → Repeat
Multi-Agent OrchestrationParallel agents handle research, implementation, and review
Knowledge CompoundingLearnings are systematically captured and reused
Worktree ManagementIsolated development environments for each feature
Open SourceMIT licensed, fully auditable and customizable

Prerequisites, Installation and Configuration

Section titled “Prerequisites, Installation and Configuration”

Prerequisites

Section titled “Prerequisites”
  • Claude Code installed and configured
  • Git for worktree management
  • GitHub CLI (gh) for repository operations

Installation

Section titled “Installation”

The installation process is straightforward:

Initial Configuration

Section titled “Initial Configuration”

Once installed, the plugin provides four main workflow commands:

CommandPurpose
/workflows:planTurn feature ideas into detailed implementation plans
/workflows:workExecute plans with worktrees and task tracking
/workflows:reviewMulti-agent code review before merging
/workflows:compoundDocument learnings to make future work easier

Recommended Scenarios and Best Practices

Section titled “Recommended Scenarios and Best Practices”

When to Use Compound Engineering

Section titled “When to Use Compound Engineering”

This methodology excels in these scenarios:

  1. Solo Developers Building Products - One developer can achieve what traditionally required a team of five
  2. Complex Feature Development - Multi-component features that require careful planning
  3. Knowledge-Intensive Codebases - Projects where context and patterns matter significantly
  4. Long-Term Projects - Projects where compound effects have time to accumulate

Daily Workflow Example

Section titled “Daily Workflow Example”

Here’s how a typical compound engineering session flows:

Step 1: Plan (80% of the value)

Section titled “Step 1: Plan (80% of the value)”

The agent:

  • Researches the codebase and commit history
  • Scours the internet for best practices
  • Synthesizes a detailed implementation plan
  • Identifies potential pitfalls and edge cases

Step 2: Work (20% of the value)

Section titled “Step 2: Work (20% of the value)”

The agent:

  • Creates an isolated worktree
  • Implements according to the plan
  • Writes tests alongside code
  • Tracks task completion

Step 3: Review (Critical checkpoint)

Section titled “Step 3: Review (Critical checkpoint)”

Multiple agents:

  • Review the code independently
  • Catch issues and suggest improvements
  • Evaluate against established patterns
  • Verify all acceptance criteria

Step 4: Compound (The magic happens)

Section titled “Step 4: Compound (The magic happens)”

The agent:

  • Documents lessons learned
  • Captures new patterns discovered
  • Updates project knowledge base
  • Feeds insights back into the system

Best Practices

Section titled “Best Practices”
  1. Never skip the Plan phase - This is where most value is created
  2. Always Review before merging - Multiple perspectives catch more issues
  3. Document everything - Future agents depend on this knowledge
  4. Trust the process - The compound effect takes time to manifest

Precautions, FAQ, and Troubleshooting

Section titled “Precautions, FAQ, and Troubleshooting”

Important Considerations

Section titled “Important Considerations”

⚠️ Learning Curve

The compound engineering approach requires a mindset shift. Traditional developers accustomed to “just coding” may find the emphasis on planning unfamiliar.

⚠️ Initial Investment

The first few cycles will feel slower than traditional development. This is normal - you’re building the knowledge foundation that future cycles will leverage.

⚠️ Tool Requirements

Full benefits require Claude Code with the plugin installed. The methodology is tool-agnostic in theory but optimized for this stack.

FAQ

Section titled “FAQ”

Q: Is this only for solo developers?

A: No. While Every uses it to enable solo developers to build complex products, teams can benefit even more from the systematic knowledge capture and multi-agent review process.

Q: Does this work with existing codebases?

A: Yes. The Plan phase includes researching your existing codebase, making it effective for both greenfield and brownfield projects.

Q: Can I use this with other AI coding tools?

A: The plugin is designed for Claude Code, but the compound engineering philosophy is tool-agnostic. Some Every team members also use OpenAI’s Codex CLI.

Q: What happens if the plan is wrong?

A: The Review and Compound phases capture why the plan didn’t work, feeding that learning back into future planning cycles.

Faster-Whisper: 4x Faster Speech Transcription with CTranslate2

Jan 1, 2026
Vibe Sparking

Speech-to-text technology has evolved rapidly since OpenAI released Whisper in 2022. While the original Whisper implementation set new standards for accuracy, its performance characteristics made it challenging for production deployments—especially for real-time applications and resource-constrained environments.

Enter faster-whisper by SYSTRAN—a complete reimplementation using CTranslate2 that delivers up to 4x faster transcription while maintaining accuracy and using significantly less memory.

What is Faster-Whisper?

Section titled “What is Faster-Whisper?”

Faster-whisper is a reimplementation of OpenAI’s Whisper model using CTranslate2, a high-performance inference engine optimized for Transformer models. The result is a drop-in replacement that:

  • Runs up to 4x faster than the original OpenAI implementation
  • Uses less memory with int8 quantization support on both CPU and GPU
  • Maintains identical accuracy—same model weights, just better execution
  • Removes FFmpeg dependency—uses PyAV for audio decoding instead

Performance Benchmarks

Section titled “Performance Benchmarks”

The performance improvements are substantial. Here are the official benchmarks for transcribing 13 minutes of audio:

GPU Performance (NVIDIA RTX 3070 Ti 8GB)

Section titled “GPU Performance (NVIDIA RTX 3070 Ti 8GB)”
ImplementationPrecisionBeam SizeTimeVRAM Usage
openai/whisperfp1652m23s4708MB
whisper.cppfp1651m05s4127MB
faster-whisperfp1651m03s4525MB
faster-whisper (batch=8)fp16517s6090MB
faster-whisperint8559s2926MB
faster-whisper (batch=8)int8516s4500MB

CPU Performance (Intel Core i7-12700K)

Section titled “CPU Performance (Intel Core i7-12700K)”
ImplementationPrecisionBeam SizeTimeRAM Usage
openai/whisperfp3256m58s2335MB
whisper.cppfp3252m05s1049MB
faster-whisperfp3252m37s2257MB
faster-whisper (batch=8)fp3251m06s4230MB
faster-whisperint851m42s1477MB
faster-whisper (batch=8)int8551s3608MB

Key Takeaway: With batched inference and int8 quantization, faster-whisper can transcribe 13 minutes of audio in just 16 seconds—nearly 8x faster than real-time!

Installation and Setup

Section titled “Installation and Setup”

Basic Installation

Section titled “Basic Installation”

That’s it! Unlike openai-whisper, FFmpeg is not required as a system dependency.

Section titled “GPU Support”

For GPU acceleration with CUDA 12:

Note: The latest CTranslate2 only supports CUDA 12. For CUDA 11, downgrade to ctranslate2==3.24.0.

Section titled “Usage Examples”

Model Options

Section titled “Model Options”
ModelSizeUse Case
tiny~40MBQuick drafts, low accuracy
base~75MBGeneral use, balanced
small~250MBBetter accuracy
medium~770MBHigh accuracy
large-v3~3.1GBBest accuracy (recommended)
turbo~1.6GBSpeed-optimized
distil-large-v3~1.6GBDistilled, faster inference

Why CTranslate2 Matters

Section titled “Why CTranslate2 Matters”

CTranslate2 is the secret sauce behind faster-whisper’s performance:

  1. Graph Optimization: Fuses operations and eliminates redundant computation
  2. Memory Pooling: Reuses memory allocations across requests
  3. Quantization: int8 support reduces memory bandwidth
  4. Batch Inference: Processes multiple audio chunks simultaneously
  5. Multi-threading: Efficient CPU parallelization

Production Deployment Considerations

Section titled “Production Deployment Considerations”

For Real-Time Applications

Section titled “For Real-Time Applications”
  • Use BatchedInferencePipeline with appropriate batch sizes
  • Enable VAD filtering to skip silence
  • Consider turbo or distil-large-v3 for lower latency
  • Use GPU when available

For Batch Processing

Section titled “For Batch Processing”
  • Use larger batch sizes (16-32) for maximum throughput
  • int8 quantization reduces memory with minimal accuracy loss
  • Consider large-v3 for highest accuracy when latency isn’t critical

For CPU-Only Deployments

Section titled “For CPU-Only Deployments”
  • int8 quantization is essential
  • Set OMP_NUM_THREADS to match available cores
  • Batched inference provides significant speedups

Community Ecosystem

Section titled “Community Ecosystem”

Faster-whisper has spawned a vibrant ecosystem of tools and integrations:

  • speaches - OpenAI-compatible API server with streaming
  • WhisperX - Adds speaker diarization
  • whisper-diarize - Multi-speaker transcription
  • WhisperLive - Real-time streaming transcription
  • Whisper-FastAPI - OpenAI-compatible backend

Conclusion

Section titled “Conclusion”

Faster-whisper represents a significant advancement in making Whisper practical for production deployments. Whether you’re building real-time transcription services, batch processing pipelines, or resource-constrained applications, faster-whisper delivers the performance needed without sacrificing accuracy.

The combination of CTranslate2 optimization, batched inference, and quantization support makes it the go-to choice for developers serious about speech recognition in 2025 and beyond.

OpenAgents: A Plan-First AI Framework for Safer, Approval-Based Development

Jan 1, 2026
Vibe Sparking

Introduction

Section titled “Introduction”

In the rapidly evolving landscape of AI-assisted development, safety and control have become paramount concerns. As AI coding assistants grow more powerful, developers need frameworks that balance automation with oversight. Enter OpenAgents by Darren Hinde - an open-source AI agent framework that introduces a revolutionary plan-first, approval-based approach to AI development.

Unlike traditional AI coding tools that execute commands autonomously, OpenAgents requires agents to propose their plans first and wait for human approval before executing. This simple yet powerful paradigm shift brings much-needed safety guardrails to AI-assisted development while maintaining productivity gains.

What Makes OpenAgents Different

Section titled “What Makes OpenAgents Different”

The Plan-First Philosophy

Section titled “The Plan-First Philosophy”

OpenAgents is built on a foundational principle: AI should propose, not surprise. When you give OpenAgents a task, it follows a systematic workflow:

  1. Analyze the request thoroughly
  2. Propose a detailed implementation plan
  3. Wait for your approval
  4. Execute incrementally with validation
  5. Delegate to specialists when needed
  6. Confirm completion and offer cleanup

This approval-based execution model addresses one of the biggest concerns in AI development: unintended actions. By requiring human approval before execution, OpenAgents prevents misaligned or harmful actions that could result from autonomous AI behavior.

Multi-Language Support

Section titled “Multi-Language Support”

OpenAgents stands out for its language-agnostic architecture. The framework works seamlessly with:

  • TypeScript/JavaScript - Frontend and backend web development
  • Python - Data science, machine learning, and automation
  • Go - High-performance systems and cloud services
  • Rust - Systems programming and performance-critical applications

The framework adapts to your project’s language and coding patterns automatically, making it a versatile choice for polyglot development teams.

Quality Built-In

Section titled “Quality Built-In”

OpenAgents doesn’t just write code - it ensures quality through automated processes:

  • Automatic testing - Tests are created and run automatically
  • Type checking - Validates type correctness before completion
  • Code review - Built-in security and quality analysis
  • Pattern compliance - Follows your coding standards from context files

Core Architecture

Section titled “Core Architecture”

OpenAgents uses a hierarchical agent system with clear separation of concerns:

Main Agents (User-Facing)

Section titled “Main Agents (User-Facing)”
AgentPurposeUse Case
openagentUniversal coordinatorGeneral tasks, questions, workflows (recommended default)
opencoderDevelopment specialistComplex coding, architecture, refactoring
system-builderMeta-level generatorCreating custom AI architectures

Specialized Subagents

Section titled “Specialized Subagents”

The framework includes a rich ecosystem of specialist subagents:

Core Coordination:

  • task-manager - Task breakdown and planning
  • documentation - Documentation authoring

Code Specialists:

  • coder-agent - Quick implementation tasks
  • reviewer - Code review and security analysis
  • tester - Test creation and validation
  • build-agent - Build and type checking
  • codebase-pattern-analyst - Pattern discovery

System Builder (Meta-Level):

  • domain-analyzer - Domain analysis and recommendations
  • agent-generator - XML-optimized agent generation
  • context-organizer - Context file organization
  • workflow-designer - Workflow design
  • command-creator - Custom command creation

Why Plan-First Matters

Section titled “Why Plan-First Matters”

Safety Benefits

Section titled “Safety Benefits”

The approval-based approach addresses critical AI safety concerns:

  1. Prevents unintended actions - No surprise file deletions or modifications
  2. Human oversight - Critical decisions require human judgment
  3. Transparency - See exactly what the AI plans to do
  4. Control - Stop or modify plans before execution

Enterprise Adoption

Section titled “Enterprise Adoption”

For organizations adopting AI tools, plan-first workflows provide:

  • Governance - Comply with data security and privacy requirements
  • Audit trails - Every action is documented and approved
  • Risk mitigation - Reduced chance of AI-caused incidents
  • Trust building - Developers feel more confident using AI

OpenAgents represents a thoughtful approach to AI-assisted development that prioritizes safety without sacrificing productivity. Its plan-first, approval-based workflow addresses legitimate concerns about autonomous AI behavior while enabling developers to leverage AI’s capabilities confidently.

As AI tools become more powerful, frameworks like OpenAgents that provide guardrails and oversight will be essential for responsible AI adoption in software development. Whether you’re an individual developer or part of an enterprise team, OpenAgents offers a path to AI-assisted development that doesn’t require surrendering control.

UI/UX Pro Max: A Searchable Design Intelligence Skill for Building Professional UIs

Jan 1, 2026
Vibe Sparking

Introduction

Section titled “Introduction”

Building beautiful, professional user interfaces is both an art and a science. As developers, we often struggle with design decisions - which colors work best for a SaaS dashboard? What font pairings convey professionalism? How do you implement glassmorphism effects correctly?

Enter UI/UX Pro Max - a comprehensive AI skill that transforms your coding assistant into a design expert. Created by nextlevelbuilder, this open-source tool provides a searchable database of design intelligence that works seamlessly with popular AI coding assistants.

What is UI/UX Pro Max?

Section titled “What is UI/UX Pro Max?”

UI/UX Pro Max is a searchable design database that provides instant access to professional UI/UX knowledge. Think of it as having a senior designer looking over your shoulder, ready to suggest the perfect color palette, typography combination, or UX pattern for your specific use case.

What’s Inside

Section titled “What’s Inside”

The skill contains a massive collection of design resources:

CategoryCount
UI Styles57 variations
Color Palettes95 industry-specific collections
Font Pairings56 curated combinations
Chart Types24 dashboard recommendations
Tech Stacks8 framework-specific guidelines
UX Guidelines98 best practices and rules

How It Works

Section titled “How It Works”

The workflow is brilliantly simple:

  1. You ask - Request any UI/UX task (build, design, create, implement, review, fix, improve)
  2. Skill activates - The AI automatically searches the design database
  3. Smart recommendations - Based on your product type, it finds matching design systems
  4. Code generation - Implements UI with proper colors, fonts, spacing, and best practices

Supported AI Assistants

Section titled “Supported AI Assistants”

UI/UX Pro Max is designed to work across multiple platforms:

AI AssistantInstallation

Enter awesome-startup by KrishMunot - a meticulously curated GitHub repository that serves as a comprehensive knowledge base for aspiring entrepreneurs and startup founders.

Whether you’re just starting out or looking to scale, awesome-startup provides a treasure trove of resources covering everything from foundational books to cutting-edge tools.

Pluely: The Open Source AI Assistant That's 27x Lighter Than Cluely

Dec 31, 2025
Vibe Sparking

In the world of AI meeting assistants, one name has been making waves: Cluely. Marketed as the “#1 Undetectable AI for Meetings,” Cluely raised $15M in funding to build a stealth AI assistant that helps you during meetings, interviews, and conversations—completely invisibly.

But what if you want the same powerful features without the proprietary lock-in, the hefty price tag, or the 270MB application size?

Enter Pluely—the open-source alternative that’s just 10MB, privacy-first, and built for the community.

Why Pluely Matters

Section titled “Why Pluely Matters”

Pluely represents a growing movement in the AI space: open-source, privacy-first alternatives to commercial AI tools. As developers and users become increasingly concerned about data privacy, vendor lock-in, and bloated applications, projects like Pluely offer a compelling alternative.

The Numbers Don’t Lie

Section titled “The Numbers Don’t Lie”
FeaturePluely (Open Source)Cluely (Proprietary)
App Size~10MB~270MB
Size Difference27x smallerBaseline
Compute Usage50% less CPU/RAMHeavy resource usage
Startup Time<100msSeveral seconds
Privacy100% local with your LLMData sent to servers
CostFree & Open SourceCommercial pricing
LicenseGPL-3.0Proprietary

Source: Pluely GitHub

Built with Tauri: Why It Matters

Section titled “Built with Tauri: Why It Matters”

Pluely is built with Tauri, a modern framework for building desktop applications using web technologies. This architectural choice is significant:

Tauri vs Electron Performance

Section titled “Tauri vs Electron Performance”

Based on 2024-2025 benchmarks:

  • Memory Usage: Tauri uses 50-58% less memory than Electron equivalents
  • Startup Time: Tauri apps launch in under 500ms vs ~4 seconds for Electron
  • Bundle Size: Tauri produces substantially smaller bundles by using native OS webview components instead of bundling Chromium

Sources:

  • Tauri vs Electron Comparison
  • Tauri vs Electron 2025 Comparison

Why This Matters for Users

Section titled “Why This Matters for Users”

For an AI assistant that needs to run constantly in the background:

  1. Less battery drain on laptops
  2. More resources available for other applications
  3. Instant startup when you need quick answers
  4. Smaller downloads and updates

Core Features

Section titled “Core Features”

1. Invisibility Mode

Section titled “1. Invisibility Mode”

Pluely’s signature feature is its translucent overlay window that sits above all other applications. This makes it:

  • Invisible in video calls (Zoom, Google Meet, Teams, Slack)
  • Undetectable in screen shares and recordings
  • Screenshot-proof by design
  • Perfectly stealthy during interviews and presentations

2. Real-Time Audio Capture

Section titled “2. Real-Time Audio Capture”

The system audio capture feature allows you to:

  • Record audio directly from your computer’s output
  • Transcribe meetings in real-time
  • Use voice activity detection for efficient processing

3. Multi-Provider AI Support

Section titled “3. Multi-Provider AI Support”

Unlike many alternatives that lock you into one provider, Pluely supports:

Pre-configured Providers:

  • OpenAI (GPT models)
  • Anthropic (Claude)
  • Google (Gemini)
  • xAI (Grok)
  • Mistral AI
  • Cohere
  • Perplexity
  • Groq
  • Ollama (local models)

Custom Providers: Add any LLM provider using curl commands with full flexibility for authentication, streaming, and response parsing.

4. Voice Input & Screenshots

Section titled “4. Voice Input & Screenshots”
  • Voice Input: Record and convert speech to text using multiple STT providers (OpenAI Whisper, ElevenLabs, Groq, etc.)
  • Screenshot Capture: Full screen or selection mode with manual or automatic AI processing
  • File Attachments: Attach documents, images, and code files for AI analysis

Privacy-First Architecture

Section titled “Privacy-First Architecture”

In an era where data privacy is paramount, Pluely takes a fundamentally different approach:

Local Data Storage

Section titled “Local Data Storage”
  • Conversations: Stored locally in SQLite on your device
  • Settings: Stored in browser localStorage, never transmitted
  • Credentials: Encrypted secure storage for API keys
  • No Telemetry: Zero analytics, usage tracking, or data collection

Direct API Connections

Section titled “Direct API Connections”

Pluely makes API calls directly from your device to your chosen AI provider:

  • No proxy servers
  • No middleware
  • No data collection
  • Verifiable via browser developer tools

Use Cases

Section titled “Use Cases”

Pluely shines in scenarios where you need AI assistance without detection:

  1. Job Interviews: Get real-time information and suggestions
  2. Sales Calls: Access product details instantly while maintaining professionalism
  3. Technical Meetings: Reference documentation without breaking flow
  4. Educational Presentations: Learning assistance that’s invisible to your audience
  5. Design Reviews: Analyze screenshots and get suggestions
  6. Live Coding: Debug code with syntax help in stealth mode

Installation and Usage

Section titled “Installation and Usage”

Prerequisites

Section titled “Prerequisites”
  • Node.js (v18 or higher)
  • Rust (latest stable)
  • npm or yarn
  • Tauri prerequisites for your platform

Quick Start

Section titled “Quick Start”

This creates platform-specific installers:

  • macOS: .dmg
  • Windows: .msi, .exe
  • Linux: .deb, .rpm, .AppImage

The Competitive Landscape

Section titled “The Competitive Landscape”

Pluely isn’t the only player in the invisible AI assistant space. Other alternatives include:

  • LockedInAI: Desktop app for stealth interview assistance
  • Final Round AI: Coaching for job interviews with video call integration
  • Beyz AI: Stealth mode for technical and behavioral questions

However, Pluely distinguishes itself through:

  • Open source transparency (GPL-3.0 license)
  • Extremely small footprint (10MB vs competitors’ 100MB+)
  • Multi-provider flexibility (not locked into one AI service)
  • Active development with regular releases

Sources:

  • Cluely Alternatives 2025
  • Cluely Alternatives - Fellow

Ethical Considerations

Section titled “Ethical Considerations”

It’s worth addressing the elephant in the room: the ethics of invisible AI assistance.

Several sources note these tools can be used for “cheating in live conversations,” which raises legitimate concerns about:

  • Academic integrity during online exams
  • Professional authenticity in job interviews
  • Fairness in competitive scenarios

Pluely and similar tools are powerful, and with power comes responsibility. The open-source nature of Pluely at least provides transparency—you can inspect exactly what the software does, unlike proprietary black-box alternatives.

Conclusion

Section titled “Conclusion”

Pluely represents an important trend in AI development: the move toward transparent, privacy-first, open-source alternatives to commercial offerings. Its 27x smaller footprint than Cluely demonstrates that you don’t need bloated software to deliver powerful features.

Whether you choose to use Pluely or not, its existence pushes the industry toward:

  • Better privacy practices
  • More efficient software architecture
  • Greater user control
  • Open standards over lock-in

The AI assistant wars are just getting started, and open-source projects like Pluely are ensuring users have a choice.

  • GitHub Repository: iamsrikanthnani/pluely
  • Cluely (Original): cluely.com
  • Tauri Framework: tauri.app

ClipSketch AI: Turn Video Moments into Hand-Drawn Stories with Google Gemini

Dec 29, 2025
Vibe Sparking

Introduction: From Video Frames to Hand-Drawn Stories

Section titled “Introduction: From Video Frames to Hand-Drawn Stories”

Content creators on platforms like Bilibili and Xiaohongshu (Little Red Book) face a common challenge: how to transform video highlights into engaging, shareable content that stands out. Traditional video editing is time-consuming, and converting video moments into stylized content typically requires artistic skills or expensive tools.

ClipSketch AI by RanFeng offers an innovative solution. This open-source web application leverages Google Gemini’s multimodal AI to automatically convert video moments into beautiful hand-drawn storyboard illustrations, complete with AI-generated social media captions.

What is ClipSketch AI?

Section titled “What is ClipSketch AI?”

ClipSketch AI is an AI-powered content creation workstation designed specifically for video creators, social media operators, and remix enthusiasts. It goes beyond simple video playback by integrating frame-level marking with Google Gemini’s latest multimodal large models to generate hand-drawn style storyboards and viral social media copy.

Key Features

Section titled “Key Features”
FeatureClipSketch AITraditional Workflow
Video SourcesBilibili + XiaohongshuManual Download
Frame PrecisionMillisecond-level MarkingApproximate
Art GenerationAI Hand-Drawn StyleManual Artwork
Caption Writing3 AI StylesManual Writing
CostFree (API Key)$10-50/mo Tools
Open SourceMIT LicenseProprietary

Technical Stack

Section titled “Technical Stack”
  • Frontend: React 19 with TypeScript
  • Styling: Tailwind CSS 3
  • AI Engine: Google GenAI SDK with Gemini 2.0 Pro
  • Storage: IndexedDB for local state persistence
  • Utilities: JSZip for packaging, Canvas API for screenshots

Core Features

Section titled “Core Features”

1. Powerful Video Acquisition

Section titled “1. Powerful Video Acquisition”

ClipSketch AI supports direct importing from popular Chinese social platforms:

  • Multi-Source Import: Parse sharing links from Bilibili and Xiaohongshu (supports short links and mixed text)
  • HD Playback: Adaptive layout optimization for vertical (9:16) and widescreen videos
  • Precise Control: Keyboard shortcuts (Space for play/pause, arrow keys for frame-by-frame or smart stepping)

2. Frame-Level Marking System

Section titled “2. Frame-Level Marking System”

The built-in marking system provides professional-grade precision:

  • Millisecond Recording: Capture every highlight moment with precision
  • Shortcut Tagging: Press T key to quickly mark frames
  • Data Export: Export timeline labels as TXT or package tagged frames as ZIP image packages

3. AI Art Studio (Powered by Gemini)

Section titled “3. AI Art Studio (Powered by Gemini)”

The heart of ClipSketch AI is its AI-powered creative suite:

Intelligent Drawing

Section titled “Intelligent Drawing”

Uses the gemini-2.0-flash-exp model to transform multiple tagged frames into a cohesive, cute hand-drawn style storyboard.

Social Caption Generation

Section titled “Social Caption Generation”

Leverages gemini-2.0-flash-exp to automatically generate 3 different styles of viral copy:

  • Emotional Story: Engaging narrative-driven content
  • Tutorial Style: Practical how-to guides
  • Short & Punchy: Concise, impact-focused copy

Character Fusion

Section titled “Character Fusion”

Upload custom characters/avatars, and the AI automatically integrates them into storyboard scenes.

Cover Generation

Section titled “Cover Generation”

Create high-quality vertical video covers based on selected copy and original frames.

Batch Refinement

Section titled “Batch Refinement”

Support batch generation and optimization of storyboards (configurable to use Batch API for cost savings).

4. Cross-Platform Adaptation

Section titled “4. Cross-Platform Adaptation”
  • Responsive Design: Perfect for PC widescreen, iPad tablet, and mobile vertical operation
  • Mobile Optimization: Automatically switches to vertical layout on phones for intuitive operation

Section titled “Quick Start”

Prerequisites

Section titled “Prerequisites”
  • Node.js (v18+)
  • A valid Google Gemini API Key

Installation and Usage

Section titled “Installation and Usage”

Visit http://localhost:3000 to access the application.

Usage Workflow

Section titled “Usage Workflow”

  1. Import Video: Copy Bilibili or Xiaohongshu share link (text included is fine), paste into the input box, click “Import Video”

  2. Mark Material: Use Space to control playback, ←/→ to adjust progress. When you see a highlight, click Tag button or press keyboard T key

  3. Enter AI Studio: After marking, click “Next: AI Drawing” at the bottom of the list on the right

  4. Create Content:

    • Paste your Gemini API Key in the upper right (if not configured in environment variables)
    • Creative Analysis: AI analyzes video steps
    • Image Generation: Generate hand-drawn storyboards, optionally fusing custom characters
    • Storyboard Refinement: HD redrawing of each frame (supports batch mode)
    • Copy & Cover: Generate social media copy and create matching covers

  5. Export & Share: Download generated storyboard images, covers, or package all materials. One-click copy your favorite copy.

Section titled “Important Considerations”

Section titled “API Requirements”

Cross-Origin Playback

Section titled “Cross-Origin Playback”

To support external video link playback and screenshots, this project uses specific proxy strategies and referrerPolicy="no-referrer".

Whether you’re a social media operator, content creator, or remix enthusiast, ClipSketch AI offers a free, powerful alternative to commercial content creation tools.
